name: Logging Management Standard
statement: The Logging Management Standard (TECH05.01) specifies requirements and supporting information for managing Information Technology (IT) and Cybersecurity controls related to American Express (AXP) logging management. It applies a risk-based assessment methodology proportionate to the technical or process vulnerabilities and accounts for threat behaviors to strengthen cybersecurity control implementation.
scope: Production and non-production platforms, infrastructure, network, systems, and security solutions. Production and externally accessible applications.
responsibility: American Express (AXP) Entity colleagues and Third Parties who own, manage and support AXP information resources.
exceptionCriteria: To submit a request for a standard exception, utilize the Exceptions Management Process.
adoptionSchedule: Adoption of new or updated requirements is 90 days from most recent publication date, as documented in the footer, unless otherwise specified.

requirements.text: Logging must be enabled to capture activity on all platforms, infrastructure, network, systems, applications, security solutions, or any other log sources required to support the specified capabilities.
Logs must be classified per the Information Security (IS) Information Management Standard (TECH02.01) and secured based upon their content.
Security and Audit Logs must be forwarded to a centralized repository and retained for at least 12 months, with a minimum of 3 months online.
Operational Logs should be retained according to the operational needs as defined by the information resource owner and support teams.
Logs requiring review and analysis must be made available and integrated with appropriate processes. Frequency and method for review can vary depending on risk and requirements.
System clocks not maintained by a hypervisor or cloud provider must enable time synchronization to maintain accurate time.
Logs must include an accurate timestamp with time zone identification that enables automated processing.
It is recommended to set the time zone for systems to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) except for end user devices.
Logs must be forwarded to a central repository.
Logs must be protected from unauthorized modification or deletion.
Logs must be restricted to authorized users.
Log settings, configuration, and delivery mechanisms must be protected from unauthorized deletion or modification.

Event records must include: Timestamp (accurate and including zone information), Event Type, Identity or credential information, Unique Source Identifier, Severity or Level, Outcome/result/result code, Process or command line arguments, Unique session or transaction identifier, Network resources, Protocol Specific information.

eventTypes: Management of identities, users, accounts, groups, roles
Management of encryption keys, secrets, certificates
Management of network, storage, system resources
Access control lists or firewall rules changes
Security rules, filters, or policies changes
Denied or blocked network or system activity
requiredAttributes: Unique Source Identifier (hostname, IP, instance ID)
Network resources (hostname, ASN, IPs, ports, protocol, VLAN)
